abstract: Foxconn Technology has made progress toward better safety conditions, but employees are still working longer than Chinese law allows.
snippet: Foxconn Technology has made progress toward better safety conditions, but employees are still working longer than Chinese law allows.
lead_paragraph: Foxconn Technology, the company that manufactures Apple’s popular iPads and iPhones, has made substantial progress toward improving safety and other working conditions at three of its Chinese plants dedicated to making Apple products. But it has not yet achieved the most difficult goal: reducing the average workweek to the maximum allowed by Chinese law, a global monitoring group said on Thursday.

headline.main: Foxconn Audit Finds a Workweek Still Too Long
headline.print_headline: Foxconn Audit Finds a Workweek Still Too Long

abstract: The China Investment Federation, a new organization supporting Sino-American deal-making, celebrated the opening of its New York office on Thursday with officials from Wall Street and China.
snippet: The China Investment Federation, a new organization supporting Sino-American deal-making, celebrated the opening of its New York office on Thursday with officials from Wall Street and China.
lead_paragraph: Shaolin-style martial arts. A plate-spinning acrobat. Musicians playing the dizi, a Chinese bamboo flute, and the yangqin, a hammered dulcimer.

headline.main: A Toehold for China on Wall Street
